Add footnotes to table

Source: R/tt_footnote.R
tt_footnote.Rd

Adds footnotes below the table. Supports general notes, numbered notes, and symbol-marked notes.

Usage

tt_footnote(table, general = NULL, number = NULL, symbol = NULL)

Arguments

table

A typst_table object.

general

Character vector of general footnotes (no markers).

number

Character vector of numbered footnotes (1, 2, 3...).

symbol

Character vector of symbol footnotes (*, †, ‡...).

Value

The modified typst_table object.

Examples

# Add a general note
tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3], rownames = FALSE) |>
  tt_footnote(general = "Source: Motor Trend magazine, 1974.")
#> #table(
#>   columns: (1fr, 1fr, 1fr),
#>   stroke: none,
#>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt),
#>   [mpg], [cyl], [disp],
#>   table.hline(stroke: 0.5pt),
#>   [21], [6], [160],
#>   [21], [6], [160],
#>   [22.8], [4], [108],
#>   [21.4], [6], [258],
#>   [18.7], [8], [360],
#>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt)
#> )
#> 
#> #text(size: 0.9em)[
#> Source: Motor Trend magazine, 1974.
#> ] 

# Add numbered footnotes
tt(mtcars[1:5, 1:3], rownames = FALSE) |>
  tt_footnote(number = c("Miles per gallon", "Number of cylinders"))
#> #table(
#>   columns: (1fr, 1fr, 1fr),
#>   stroke: none,
#>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt),
#>   [mpg], [cyl], [disp],
#>   table.hline(stroke: 0.5pt),
#>   [21], [6], [160],
#>   [21], [6], [160],
#>   [22.8], [4], [108],
#>   [21.4], [6], [258],
#>   [18.7], [8], [360],
#>   table.hline(stroke: 1pt)
#> )
#> 
#> #text(size: 0.9em)[
#> 1. Miles per gallon \
#> 2. Number of cylinders
#> ]
